SPA 2nd session closes
   Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- The 2nd session of the 10th Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK that opened here on April 7 closed today after a successful discussion of its agenda items.    A decision of the SPA of the DPRK "on the summing up of the fulfillment of the state budget for Juche 87 (1998) in the DPRK," ordinances of the SPA of the DPRK "on the state budget for Juche 88 (1999) in the DPRK" and "on adopting a law of the DPRK on the plan of the national economy" were adopted with a unanimous approval of the deputies.

articles.content:
10-day film show to commemorate Sun's Day
      Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- A 10-day film show opened to commemorate Sun's Day, the birthday of the President Kim Il Sung.   Documentary and feature films on the President's revolutionary life and activities will be screened at all the cinema houses across the country in the show period.   Among them are documentaries "the Fatherly leader finding himself among workers" and "the Great History" and feature films "Star of Korea," "the Sun of the Nation" and serials of "the Nation and Destiny."  Cinema-goers will also see documentaries on the noble traits of the Kim Jong Il and his revolutionary activities.   Its national opening ceremony was held at the People's Palace of Culture.

articles.content:
Russian Alexandrov Army Choir and Dance Ensemble
   Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- The Russian Alexandrov Army Choir and Dance Ensemble which had come here to attend the 17th April Spring Friendship Art Festival gave a performance at the Mansudae Art Theatre on Thursday before its opening.   It was appreciated by vice-Minister of Culture Song Sok Hwan, who is vice-chairman of the organizing committee of the art festival, officials concerned and working people in Pyongyang.   Among those in the audience were Russian ambassador Valery Denisov and embassy officials.   Their repertoire included Korean songs, Russian songs and dances and other numbers.

articles.title: S. Korean authority's' move against north
Kim Jong Il praised as defender of world peace and socialism
articles.content:
S. Korean authority's' move against north
   Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- The South Korean "Ministry of National Defence" announced on April 6 that it would lengthen the "ROK army" radio broadcasting time and make its network which has been confined to Seoul and its surrounding areas spread all over South Korea, a Seoul-based radio report said. The move is intended to cover up the reactionary nature of the "ROK army" as a shameful mercenary of the U.S., to dampen the people's  anti-"ROK army" sentiment and incite anti-north war fever.

articles.title: Sun's Day commemorated abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il praised as defender of world peace and socialism
   Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- T. B. Mukherjee, president of the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea, in a recent interview with the KCNA correspondent in India highly praised the greatness of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.    He said that the great Kim Jong Il is identical to the respected President Kim Il Sung in idea, virtues and traits and that under his wise guidance socialism victoriously advances in the DPRK.   Kim Jong Il's politics is based on warm love for popular masses and firm trust in the revolutionary comrades and he travels a lot to mix with the people, Mukherjee said, and went on:   The people of the five continents highly praise him as defender of world peace and socialism.   He, the benevolent father of the people, put socialism on a firm foundation.

articles.content:
Message of sympathy to Indian Prime Minister
   Pyongyang, April 9 ( KCNA) -- Premier of the cabinet of the DPRK Hong Song Nam sent a message of sympathy to Atal Bihari Vajpayee, Prime Minister of the Republic of India,  in connection with  big human and economic losses from a recent earthquake in its Uttar Pradesh state.Extending deep sympathy and condolence to him and, through him, to  the population in the afflicted area,  the message expressed the belief that the Indian government and people would recover from earthquake damage as early as possible and  their life return to normal.

articles.content:
Greetings to president of Finnish Parliament
   Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- Chairman of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly Choe Thae Bok sent a message of greetings to Jukka Mikkola on his appointment as president of the Finnish Parliament. In the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries and parliaments would develop on good terms in the idea of independence, peace and friendship, the message wished him great success in his responsible work.
